akas: Moochie Kalala Detectives Club USA (first season title)
akas from release info: Moochie Kalala Detectives Club USA (first season title)

-1.title: Look Out! The Sky Is Literally Falling.
-1.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

1.title: Space Dragon of Oceanic Mars
1.plot: After Grandpa tells his story about a dragon guarding water on Mars, Mandy and Kyle jet over to the Adler Planetarium and meet planetary scientist Mark Hammergren to learn the truth about Mars.

2.title: Hoagies vs Grabinators of Skunksville
2.plot: Did you know that tornadoes are made from grabinators and hoagies? Neither did Kyle and Mandy, until Grandpa told his story. To check the facts, the detectives head to Museum of Science and Industry and meet with physicist Olivia Castellini.

3.title: We're All Good at Something
3.plot: Mandy think she's the best at everything until grandpa tells his story about Moochie Kalala in a contest with a Chimpanzee and a Gorilla. To check the facts, she and Kyle will meet Primatologist Steve Ross at the Lincoln Park Zoo.

4.title: The Cave Girl and the T. Rex
4.plot: Grandpa's story puts Moochie Kalala toe-to-toe with a T-Rex. People and dinosaurs did not live at the same time. Or did they? Paleontologist Bill Simpson from The Field Museum helps Mandy and Kyle explore the facts.

5.title: The Magic Blocks of Creation
5.plot: Grandpa says Frank Lloyd Wright used magic blocks to build the Robie House. When Mandy and Kyle go on a mission to find the blocks, they uncover a whole lot more meeting architect Royce Yeater.

6.title: A Whale of a Tale
6.plot: Moochie is rescued at sea by a singing Beluga whale. Once again, Grandpa's crazy story sends Kyle and Mandy on a journey to Shedd Aquarium to discover the facts from marine animal trainer Elizabeth Davis.

imdb.plot outline: Two young kids form the Moochie Kalala Detectives Club to uncover the truth behind their grandpa's wild stories. Every Saturday, Grandpa (Tim Kazurinsky) comes over and shares a ridiculous story that twists the kids thinking about science. To uncover the real story, the kids head to Museums and Zoos and meet with real scientists to discover the truth. Episodes feature museums and scientists from Adler Planetarium, The Field Museum, John G. Shedd Aquarium, Museum of Science & Industry, Lincoln Park Zoo and Frank Lloyd Wright Trust.
imdb.title: Detectives Club
plot: Two young kids form the Moochie Kalala _Detectives Club_ (qv) to uncover the truth behind their grandpa's wild stories. Every Saturday, Grandpa (Tim Kazurinsky) comes over and shares a ridiculous story that twists the kids thinking about science. To uncover the real story, the kids head to Museums and Zoos and meet with real scientists to discover the truth. Episodes feature museums and scientists from Adler Planetarium, The Field Museum, John G. Shedd Aquarium, Museum of Science & Industry, Lincoln Park Zoo and Frank Lloyd Wright Trust.
synopsis: The Moochie Kalala Detectives Club was formed to discover the truth behind Grandpas crazy stories. Seriously, dinosaurs and people living together? Belugas that sing? Tornadoes that make skunks! We dont think so either, so join us on missions to the Chicago Museums to meet with real scientists and gather the facts. Together we can uncover the truth! Because with every new story, comes a new adventure on the Moochie Kalala Detectives Club!Chicagos own Dreaming Tree Films has been creating youth-centric TV shows, films and original content since 2002, all purposed to make a difference in young lives. Before the release of Moochie Kalala Detectives Club, Dreaming Tree released The Stream, a coming-of-age family comedy featuring Mario Lopez (Extra), Kelly Rutherford (Gossip Girl), Christopher Gorham (Covert Affairs) and Rainn Wilson (The Office). Released in theatres and currently available on iTunes, Amazon and Walmart, proceeds from the feature film benefit Boys & Girls Clubs of America. Other Dreaming Tree projects include Fresh Films, a teen filmmaking platform where Teens Replace the Pros, All Access, a music documentary featuring Blink 182 and Weezer and Got Noise, an original production of Ushers music videos by youth.
